a.class: vc_general vc_btn3 vc_btn3-size-md vc_btn3-shape-rounded vc_btn3-style-outline vc_btn3-block vc_btn3-color-black

div.class: vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_black

div.p: The mission of the Hayden School District is to promote continuous growth in student achievement by providing the support and tools to create a safe, motivating and enriching academic program which meets diverse educational needs.

div.class: vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_black

strong.em: Please visit the Food Service Page for information on the Free and Reduced Program and Application.

div.class: vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_black

div.p: As noted by the announcement Governor Polis made Wednesday, Colorado schools will remain closed at least through April 30th. A move that makes it ever less likely that in-person classes will resume this school year. He noted that school closures are a key part of the social distancing strategy that officials hope will slow the spread of the new coronavirus. As a result of this announcement, CHSAA announced the suspension of spring sports until this date also. As more information is obtained, we will update you.

Our team of teachers and support staff will continue to work to provide learning opportunities to our students. Currently, we have an online model with learning packets for those who need paper copies or do not have internet access at home. Chromebooks are available for all 2nd – 12th grade students. Younger students can check out Chromebooks or iPads, and Charter/Spectrum is providing free internet service for all families with school age students. If you need either of these supports, please contact your child’s principal to obtain more information. We are here to provide support in this transition. Please reach out with your needs.

Hayden School District will continue to provide lunch for students up to 18 years of age free of charge. Bagged meals will be available for pick up in a “Grab and Go” drive through style for families to pick up and take home. The pick-up point will be in front of the Babson Center between 5:15 – 6:15 on Tuesdays. You can remain in your car and staff will get the food to you. There will be enough in the bag for 4 days lunch. If you are interested in picking up lunch for your child(ren), please send Susan Hart an email at foodsupport@haydenschools.org to let her know that you would like to pick up food and for how many children you have.

As always, please do not hesitate to reach out whenever you need anything and to ask questions. While it is a challenging time, I am proud to serve in my role as superintendent and commend the work of all our staff. There will be bumps in the road but we need to allow each other a measure of grace as we develop plans for what school looks like in the weeks ahead.

div.p: Staff attempting to access this page should use their assigned employee number. Your Employee Number or “lunch Number” can be found in PowerSchool, or you may contact the Information Technology Department by dialing 411 or 412 from any District Telephone.
If your Employee number is not working, please contact the Information Technology Department for help.
